election_record.label: Louisiana 1812 Governor, Ballot 2

sub_unit.name: General Assembly
sub_unit.note: By Louisiana law, a general election was held for Governor. Then, the Legislature elected the Governor from the top two candidates.

"Messrs. W.C.C. Claiborne and James Villere were proclaimed to be the two candidates that had obtained the greatest number of votes. Resolved, that the general assembly do proceed to ballot the said candidates, in order to elect the chief magistrate of the state." Journal of the Louisiana House of Representatives, 1812. 4.
"Mr. Wm. C.C. Clairborne was proclaimed to be elected governor of this state." Journal of the Louisiana House of Representatives, 1812. 4.

election_record.reference: Journal of the Louisiana House of Representatives, 1812. 4.
